Package nzilbb.ag.automation

Class Annotator

  • java.lang.Object
    • nzilbb.ag.automation.Annotator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<Graph,​Graph>, UnaryOperator<Graph>, GraphTransformer, MonitorableTask
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MinimalExample, TheWorksExample, Transcriber
    public abstract class Annotator
extends Object
implements GraphTransformer, MonitorableTask
    Base class for an automated annotation module.

    When GraphTransformer.transform(Graph) is invoked, it should perform whatever annotation task has been configured by the last call to setTaskParameters(String).

    The typical lifecycle of an annotator is:

    1. The module is installed:
      1. setSchema(Schema) is invoked.
      2. getConfig() is invoked, in case the annotator has a default configuration.
      3. the user is presentated with the config web-app, if any, and
      4. setConfig(String) is invoked. (if there's no config web-app, then the config string passed will be the result of the earlier getConfig() invocation)
    2. One or more annotation tasks are created; for each one:
      1. setSchema(Schema) is invoked.
      2. the user is presented with the task web-app, if any, and
      3. setTaskParameters(String) is invoked to allow any installation processing to occur; e.g. persisting configuration, loading lexicons, etc.
    3. Annotation tasks may be then run one or more times:
      1. setSchema(Schema) is invoked to provide the current schema.
      2. setTaskParameters(String) is invoked to provide the parameters. (it's possible that this will be invoked with null parameters to determine whether the annotator has a default task configuration)
      3. getRequiredLayers() is invoked to determine which layers are needed.
      4. getOutputLayers() is invoked to determine which layer are annotated.
      5. transform(graph) is invoked with a graph that should be annotated. It can be assumed to have annotations on its input layers, and possible annotations on its output layers as well (produced by previous calls to transform(graph) or by other annotators - i.e. the annotator should not assume the output layer is empty)
    4. If there is an extensions web-app the user may visit it to access data, visualizations, etc.
    5. The module may be upgraded, in which case:
      1. setSchema(Schema) is invoked.
      2. getConfig() is invoked, to determine the pre-upgrade configuration.
      3. the user is presented with the config web-app, if any, and
      4. setConfig(String) is invoked to allow any upgrade processing to occur, e.g. updating configuration, changes in data schema, etc.
    6. The module is uninstalled, in which case uninstall() is invoked, which should remove all persistent data on the system - e.g. DROP database tables, delete data files, etc.

    The methods below marked in bold are those that an Annotator subclass should implement, in addition to transform(graph).

    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

    • Method Detail

      • getAnnotatorId

        public String getAnnotatorId()
        Unique name for the annotator, which is immutable across versions of the implemetantation.

        The default implementation returns the (simple) name of the annotator implementation class.

        Returns:
        The annotator's ID.

      • getVersion

        public String getVersion()
        Version of this implementation; versions will typically be numeric, but this is not a requirement.

        The default implementation assumes that the .jar file the annotator is deployed in has a 'comment' defined which contains the version (e.g. 20200708.1646).

        If this is not the case, or some other versioning scheme is desired, the derived class should override this method.

        Returns:
        Annotator version.

      • getMinimumApiVersion

        public abstract String getMinimumApiVersion()
        Get the minimum version of the nzilbb.ag API supported by the serializer.
        Returns:
        Minimum version of the nzilbb.ag API supported by the serializer.
        See Also:
        Constants.VERSION

      • getWorkingDirectory

        public File getWorkingDirectory()
        A persistent directory in which files can be saved and accessed.

        This is automatically called if the annotator is annotated by UsesFileSystem, providing the implementation with persistent access to the file system.

        Returns:
        A persistent directory in which files can be saved and accessed.

      • setRdbConnectionFactory

        public void setRdbConnectionFactory​(ConnectionFactory db)
                             throws SQLException
        Sets the information required for connecting to the relational database.

        This is automatically called if the annotator is annotated with UsesRelationalDatabase, providing the implementation with access to a relational database.

        Parameters:
        db - Factory for making new connections to the database.
        Throws:
        SQLException - If the annotator can't connect to the given database.

      • getConfig

        public String getConfig()
        Provides the overall configuration of the annotator.
        Returns:
        The overall configuration of the annotator, which will be passed to the config/index.html configuration web-app, if any. This configuration may be null, or a string that serializes the annotators configuration state in any encoding the implementor prefers. The resulting string must be interpretable by the config/index.html web-app.
        See Also:
        setConfig(String), beanPropertiesToQueryString()

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig​(String config)
               throws InvalidConfigurationException
        Specifies the overall configuration of the annotator, and runs any processing required to install the annotator.

        This processing is assumed to be synchronous (this method doesn't return until it's complete) and long-running, so the MonitorableTask methods should provide a way for the caller to monitor/cancel processing - i.e. the Annotator class should provide an indication of progress by calling setPercentComplete(Integer) and should regularly check isCancelling() to determine if installation should be stopped.

        If the user should provide information before this method is called, a config web-app must be provided to implement the user interface, which sets any required configuration by invoking methods of the annotator as required, and invoking setConfig when configuration is ready.

        If the configuration needs to be persistent between installing the annotator the first time and subsequently upgrading it, then it is the annotator's responsibility to serialize it in a form which can be retrieved for a later call to getConfig().

        Throws:
        InvalidConfigurationException
        See Also:
        getConfig(), beanPropertiesFromQueryString(String)

      • uninstall

        public void uninstall()
        Runs any processing required to uninstall the annotator.

      • setTaskParameters

        public abstract void setTaskParameters​(String parameters)
                                throws InvalidConfigurationException
        Sets the configuration for a given annotation task.

        If the user should provide information before an annotation task is run for the first time, a task web-app must be provided to implement the user interface, which may be provided with an existing configurtaion, and invoking setTaskParameters when ready.

        If the Annotator performs exclusively (or mainly) one annotation task only (e.g. the PorterStemmer) then calling this method with parameters = null should apply any default parameters so that the Annotator can be used without invoking the task web-app.

        The annotator may change the schema during this method, to add layers or correct the definition of output layers, as required.

        Parameters:
        parameters - The configuration of the annotator, encoded in a String using whatever mechanism is preferred (serialization of Properties object, JSON, etc.)
        Throws:
        InvalidConfigurationException

      • getRequiredLayers

        public abstract String[] getRequiredLayers()
                                    throws InvalidConfigurationException
        Determines which layers the annotator requires in order to annotate a graph.
        Returns:
        A list of layer IDs.
        Throws:
        InvalidConfigurationException - If setTaskParameters(String) or setSchema(Schema) have not yet been called.

      • getOutputLayers

        public abstract String[] getOutputLayers()
                                  throws InvalidConfigurationException

        Returns:
        A list of layer IDs.
        Throws:
        InvalidConfigurationException - If setTaskParameters(String) or setSchema(Schema) have not yet been called.

      • transformTranscripts

        public void transformTranscripts​(GraphStore store,
                                 String expression)
                          throws TransformationException,
                                 InvalidConfigurationException,
                                 StoreException,
                                 PermissionException
        Transforms all graphs from the given graph store that match the given graph expression.

        This can be overridden for optimized cross-graph updates. The default implementation simply calls GraphStoreQuery.getMatchingTranscriptIds(String) and calls GraphStoreQuery.getGraph(String,String[]) and GraphTransformer.transform(Graph) serially for each returned ID.

        Parameters:
        store - The graph store.
        expression - An expression for identifying transcripts to update, or null to transform all transcripts in the store.
        Throws:
        TransformationException
        InvalidConfigurationException - If setTaskParameters(String) or setSchema(Schema) have not yet been called.
        StoreException - If one of the store methods throws this exception.
        PermissionException - If one of the store methods throws this exception.

      • transformFragments

        public void transformFragments​(Stream<Graph> fragments,
                               Consumer<Graph> consumer)
                        throws TransformationException,
                               InvalidConfigurationException
        Transforms all fragments from the given stream.

        This can be overridden for optimized cross-graph updates. The default implementation simply calls GraphTransformer.transform(Graph) and then consumer.accept(Graph) serially for each graph.

        Parameters:
        fragments - A stream of graphs which must be transcript fragments, e.g. utterances.
        consumer - A consumer for receiving the graphs once they're transformed.
        Throws:
        TransformationException
        InvalidConfigurationException - If setTaskParameters(String) or setSchema(Schema) have not yet been called.
